reviews.title: â€œGood location+ Reasonable price +Clean room+ helpful staffs, what else you need?â€
reviews.content: If you plan to travel around the south part of Jeju Island, I definitely recommend this hotel. My room was spacious, very clean, but there was no desk, chair. Bathroom is modern but there is no door between shower tap and toilet so water slightly splashes during shower. However.....I might RETURN this hotel again !! Reasonable price, good location, clean room and helpful, friendly staffs....what else you need. I would highly recommend Jeju Aerospace Hotel to all international visitors looking for a reliable and comfortable stay. Thank you once again for your outstanding services. Regards! Dr.Muhammad Zubair Pakistan

reviews.title: â€œVery convenient location; clean and cosy room, friendly staffs. â€
reviews.content: My cousin living in Europe, visited grannie's during his vacation. It was just at the edge of the highest season and the price was very favorable; they loved spacious parking and reachable distance to the sunrise peak. I was very happy that this lagoon-faced new facility gave a lot of comfort for the expats' like my cousin and his son. Will definitely visit there again with my family.

reviews.title: â€œGoodâ€
reviews.content: Itâ€™s located about a 10-15 minute walk from Seogwipoâ€™s Olle Market, making it a great spot for exploring the market in the evening. While the on-site parking space is small, there are nearby parking options, so itâ€™s not inconvenient. During our stay, the boiler broke down, but we received a 50% discount on the accommodation fee, and since the hot water and heating system worked well afterward, we didnâ€™t experience any discomfort. If youâ€™re expecting a luxury hotel, you might feel slightly underwhelmed, but overall, itâ€™s a satisfying place to stay.

reviews.title: â€œConvenient, comfortable, and classyâ€
reviews.content: The Shilla Jeju has been one of my favourite hotels since the 90s. There are some programs available as well as the beautiful gardens with volcanic rock walkways to the beach/viewpoints and the pools to keep both children and adults happy. Though the hotel has been around, it does not feel outdated. The facilities are well kept with top-notch services by helpful and friendly staff, thereby providing classy comfort and quiet luxury for the guests. The Jeju Shilla also offers great culinary experience. The icecream bars at lunch/dinner buffets, the seafood noodle soup by the pool, and the room service were particularly memorable. Keep in mind, however, that the most rooms have two twin beds or a queen bed, making it tricky to have three adults in a room. Additional beds are available for a fee, but it takes up extra space and paying an additional fee for the third person seems redundant when you have already booked and paid for three. Overall, the Jeju Shilla is a place for you if you are looking for a convenient, comfortable, and classy resort in Jeju.

reviews.title: â€œWorst serviceâ€
reviews.content: According to their website the swimming pool is open from 6:30Am to 8pm. But when we check in before 9pm it was already closed. By the morning my daughter wants to go swimming but according to the front desk it will open at 12:00. So bad because the check out time is 11:Am so we didn't able to use the swimming pool which was the only reason why we choose that hotel because my daughter likes swimming. Terrible experience.. Waste of time and money

reviews.title: â€œReasonably priced located on the bike routeâ€
reviews.content: I was on a trip to ride a bicycle around the Jeju island and on the first night, I book this place when it started to get dark. There was no one at the desk so quickly downloaded Agoda app and book this place. And used a Kiosk to communicate to check in. Nothing fancy, just a clean room with bathroom and shower. It was good enough to restup . My room did have a view to the ocean.

reviews.title: â€œNice Hotelâ€
reviews.content: It is a pleasant and clean hotel that I always visit again for hiking in Hallasan Mountain. It's been a long time since I visited, and shampoo, shower wash, and conditioner are not provided in the room due to stricter disposable product regulations in the hotel, so please refer to them when visiting the hotel. In my personal opinion, the regulation of toothpaste and toothbrush is understandable, but I wonder if it's a little too much not to put shampoo, conditioner and shower wash on.

reviews.title: â€œA perfect hotel near Jeju airportâ€
reviews.content: Driving just 12 minutes to the hotel from the airport; comfortable condition for parking, check-in and look around jeju ocean. All the facilities in the hotel are very clean, fancy and easy to access including outdoor pools. All staffs in the hotel are very kind and placed in everywhere to help guests. The most important things to choose this hotel is reasonable price and tasty food; breakfast and cafe, too.

reviews.title: â€œBest location & best viewâ€
reviews.content: The poolvilla had the best location and the best view in jeju island. The poolvilla is small but clean and very stylish. A famous beach is very close maybe 5 minutes walking. We enjoyed our time so much. Everyone loved it.

reviews.title: â€œGreat view, great hospitalityâ€
reviews.content: Visiting Jeju is like being in a different country, very different from Seoul. Since it's overseas, we were quite sensitive about safety, but it is very safe and quiet. The host was incredibly kind, recommending nearby travel spots, and when we got lost, we safely returned to the accommodation with the host's help. The sea in Jeju is truly beautiful, and with the ocean right in front of us, the view from the bed while looking at the sea is amazing.

reviews.room_type: Double Room, Private Pool, Ocean View

reviews.title: â€œì¸ìƒ ìµœì•…ì˜ ìˆ™ì†Œ (The worst accommodation of my life)â€
reviews.content: 1. Hygiene - there were bug corpses, bugs, and there were so many spots on bedding that were not cleaned properly. The door lock was so dirty that I didn't want to touch it, and all the furniture and equipment in the accommodation were uncomfortable to touch. 2. Service - I asked to change the bedding, but only the top blanket was brought and changed, and the new bedding wasn't very clean either. 3. Price - it is not cheap even during the off-season, but it was such a waste of money. I'd rather go to a business hotel. I'd recommend never going. )

reviews.title: â€œBest View in Jeju so far!!â€
reviews.content: The hotel is a small nice little villa with great parking. The inside looked very modern but a bit small. We knew we made the right choice when we saw the view from the room. It was the best we have seen in Jeju. Highly recommend checking it out.

reviews.title: â€œView is the best in Koreaâ€
reviews.content: Room was clean and staff were kind and the brkfast was very good. pool is very small but it is private so it was ok. However the view was just so great that enjoying it was what we did the entire trip. Recommended

reviews.title: â€œGood hotel with Ocean view rooms!â€
reviews.content: The room was much brighter and cleaner than the photos on website. The ocean view room was impressive, with the beach visible through the window. The live performances at the bar in the evening were fantastic. There are many great restaurants near the hotel, which was convenient. Although it is slightly more expensive than other nearby hotels, the excellent facilities and relatively spacious rooms made it worth it.

reviews.title: â€œGreat Value â€“ A Hotel I Appreciate Even More After Traveling Abroadâ€
reviews.content: Back when I stayed at Kenny Stay Jeju, I didnâ€™t think much of itâ€”just a decent, budget-friendly hotel in Korea. But after traveling abroad and experiencing different accommodations, Iâ€™ve come to realize that finding a hotel like this at this price point is almost impossible elsewhere. Korean hotels, in general, offer great value, and this one was no exception. One of the best things about this hotel was its location. Being close to the market, I could easily walk around, explore the local scene, and immerse myself in the lively atmosphere. I have great memories of wandering through the market, discovering different stalls, and picking up delicious food to bring back and enjoy at the hotel. What I also appreciated was how warm and comfortable the room was at night, with hot water readily available and a working TVâ€”things that seem basic in Korea but arenâ€™t always guaranteed when traveling abroad. Iâ€™ve stayed in plenty of places where even these essentials werenâ€™t provided, so looking back, I realize how reliable and comfortable my stay at Kenny Stay was. If youâ€™re looking for a solid, affordable option in Jeju with all the essentials covered, Kenny Stay is definitely a great choice!

Very convenient to use public transportation from (or to) downtown Jeju-si, eastern Jeju island area, and Jungmun. For facility, I used 1-person room. Room was not big, but just enough for a solo traveler. Very clean and well organized. High recommanded. Only one thing- It may be very hard to use elevator during rush hour(?) as there is not enough mumber of elevator compared to the number of rooms. Other than E/V, highly recommanded.

reviews.title: â€œVery goodâ€
reviews.content: We visited as a family trip. With my children, this is the hotel swimming pool, which is one of the first things to consider when choosing a hotel. I expected the Parnas Hotel to be infinity pool indoors and outdoors and especially hot water, but it is the best swimming pool as I expected. It is nice that the promenade around the hotel is connected to the sandy beach. Fitness is small, but the quality of equipment is good. And I love the scent of diffusers in the hotel.

reviews.title: â€œThe best of the best that Jeju has to offerâ€
reviews.content: The stay at Parnas Jeju was absolutely amazing, and would rate it at the top of the list for Jeju. We stayed at the top level Junior Suite room and the sea view was spectacular. The room was very clean and near perfection, and the service was top notch. The lobby had an amazing presence and the architecture overall, was very impressive. Everything felt spacious and the interior design was also very impressive all around. We had breakfast and dinner at Confetti, and both were of a high standard, especially breakfast. The customer service is some of the best I have experienced and the professionalism was also very impressive. All the facilities and amenities were at the highest standard, and it could be felt first hand. The location also feels very private, and the short walk to the beach was also convenient. I definitely plan to come back and want to thank the staff at Parnas for providing such a wonderful stay. A must recommend to everyone visiting Jeju.
